sprint_goal: Establish foundational system: User roles, RBAC, core master data models (Customer, Driver, Vehicle, Route, Material), and user login.
epic_coverage: Core System & Odoo Foundation, Master Data Management
key_deliverables: Functional user login, Core RBAC structure, All primary master data models created.
demo_objectives: Admin can log in and create a new record for a Vehicle, Driver, Customer, Route, and Material.
success_criteria: All master data models are defined and accessible in the UI to an Admin; RBAC groups are created.
risk_factors: Incomplete requirements for master data fields.
mitigation_strategies: Confirm all fields with PO before starting development.

sprint_name: Sprint 2: Master Data Refinement & Trip Creation
sprint_goal: Complete Master Data Management (Edit, Deactivate) and implement core Trip Creation workflow with all necessary validations.
epic_coverage: Core System & Odoo Foundation, Master Data Management, Trip Lifecycle Management
key_deliverables: Ability to edit and deactivate users/master data; A functional 'Create Trip' form.
demo_objectives: Show deactivation of a user; Demonstrate all validations on the 'Create Trip' form.
success_criteria: A Dispatch Manager can successfully create a 'Planned' trip with valid data.
risk_factors: Complexity in validation logic for trip creation.
mitigation_strategies: Write comprehensive unit tests for all validation rules.

sprint_goal: Implement Trip Assignment workflow with all compliance validations and add document management.
epic_coverage: Trip Lifecycle Management, Master Data Management
key_deliverables: Ability to assign a driver/vehicle to a trip; Document upload for vehicles.
demo_objectives: Show filtered lists of available drivers/vehicles during assignment; Demonstrate validations (capacity, license); Upload a vehicle document.
success_criteria: A 'Planned' trip can be successfully moved to 'Assigned' state with compliant resources.
risk_factors: Logic for resource 'availability' might be complex.
mitigation_strategies: Clearly define 'availability' with PO (e.g., only checks 'In-Transit' status).

sprint_goal: Deliver Driver Portal MVP: Login, view assigned trips, start a trip, log events, and upload Proof of Delivery.
key_deliverables: A functional mobile web portal for drivers with core trip execution workflow.
demo_objectives: Demonstrate the complete driver workflow on a mobile device: Login -> View Trips -> Start Trip -> Log Event -> Upload POD -> Trip is 'Delivered'.
success_criteria: A driver can complete their core workflow without assistance.
risk_factors: Mobile responsiveness issues across different devices; Complexity in OWL components.
mitigation_strategies: Test on a range of emulators and physical devices.

sprint_goal: Implement the complete Expense Submission and Approval workflow, and add core Trip Exception Handling.
epic_coverage: Financial Management & Invoicing, Trip Lifecycle Management
key_deliverables: Driver expense submission form; Manager approval queue; Trip exception handling (On Hold, Cancel).
demo_objectives: Driver submits an expense -> Manager approves/rejects it. Driver logs a critical event -> Trip goes 'On Hold' -> Manager resumes trip.
success_criteria: End-to-end expense workflow is functional; Trip exception states are manageable.
risk_factors: Complexity of state transitions and their side-effects (e.g., notifications).
mitigation_strategies: Create state diagram and write integration tests for all transitions.

sprint_goal: Solidify financial calculations by implementing trip profitability, adding robust expense validations, and creating the draft invoice workflow.
epic_coverage: Financial Management & Invoicing, Trip Lifecycle Management
key_deliverables: Accurate trip profitability calculation; Validated expense data entry; 'Create Invoice' button on completed trips.
demo_objectives: Show a trip's profitability update as an expense is approved; Demonstrate odometer and file validation on expense form; Create a draft invoice from a trip.
success_criteria: All financial calculations are validated and correct; Draft invoice generation is functional.
mitigation_strategies: Peer review of all calculation logic and extensive unit testing with edge cases.

sprint_goal: CRITICAL: Implement the end-to-end GST E-Invoicing integration, including the GSP client, workflow, and failure/intervention handling.
key_deliverables: A functional, compliant e-invoicing system with resilient API communication.
demo_objectives: Generate a live (sandbox) e-invoice; Show sync/async fallback on simulated API failure; Demonstrate manual intervention workflow.
success_criteria: An invoice can be successfully processed to get an IRN from the GSP sandbox; PDF report is compliant.
risk_factors: GSP API instability or poor documentation (RISK-001); Complexity of sync/async logic.
mitigation_strategies: Start with API technical spike; Implement comprehensive logging; Write extensive integration tests with a mock server.
integration_windows: Continuous integration with GSP sandbox throughout the sprint.
burndown_target: Steep burndown in the second week after initial integration challenges.

sprint_goal: Complete the core financial loop with payment recording and customer ledgers. Establish the foundational notification system and card management.
epic_coverage: Financial Management & Invoicing, Core System & Odoo Foundation
key_deliverables: Payment recording functionality; Customer ledger view; Centralized notification service; Card management module.
demo_objectives: Record a payment against an invoice; Show the updated customer ledger; Trigger a sample notification.
success_criteria: The trip-to-cash cycle is functionally complete; The notification system is ready for integration.
risk_factors: Complexity of running balance calculation in the ledger.
mitigation_strategies: Investigate Odoo's standard partner ledger first before building custom logic.

sprint_goal: Surface data via dashboards and alerts, and configure notifications.
epic_coverage: Reporting & Dashboards, Core System & Odoo Foundation
key_deliverables: Manager Dashboard with KPIs; Critical Alerts Panel; Alert generation logic for documents, licenses, and card balances; Notification preference screen.
demo_objectives: Show the manager dashboard with live data; Trigger an alert (e.g., by lowering card balance) and see it appear on the dashboard; Configure notification preferences.
success_criteria: Dashboard is functional and provides at-a-glance insights; Alerts are generated and displayed correctly.
risk_factors: Performance of dashboard queries; Real-time update complexity.
mitigation_strategies: Optimize data aggregation queries; Leverage Odoo's bus for real-time UI updates.

sprint_goal: Deliver core operational and financial reporting suites with export functionality.
key_deliverables: Operational reports (Trip, Utilization, etc.); Financial reports (Aging, Revenue, etc.); PDF/Excel export for all reports.
demo_objectives: Generate each report with filters applied; Export a report to both PDF and Excel.
success_criteria: All specified reports are functional and data is accurate; Exports are well-formatted.
risk_factors: Performance of reporting queries on large datasets.
mitigation_strategies: Use optimized SQL queries via `env.cr.execute()` instead of the ORM for complex aggregations; Add database indexes on filtered fields.

sprint_goal: Deliver advanced analytical reports and add driver self-service features.
epic_coverage: Reporting & Dashboards, Driver Portal & Mobile Experience
key_deliverables: Driver Performance, Fuel Efficiency, Vehicle Profitability, and Detailed Expense reports; Driver cash advance and leave request features.
demo_objectives: Generate the new reports; Demonstrate a driver submitting a leave request.
success_criteria: All reports are functional; New driver portal features are working.
risk_factors: Data quality issues impacting report accuracy (e.g., missing odometer readings).
mitigation_strategies: Handle null/missing data gracefully in report calculations (show 'N/A').

sprint_goal: Establish CI/CD foundation: Containerize applications and build the CI pipeline for automated quality checks.
key_deliverables: Dockerfiles for Odoo and FastAPI; A functional GitHub Actions CI pipeline.
demo_objectives: Show a pull request triggering the CI pipeline; Demonstrate a build failing due to a linting error or failed test.
success_criteria: CI pipeline enforces all quality gates (lint, test, coverage) on every pull request.
risk_factors: Complexity in setting up Odoo test environment in a CI runner.
mitigation_strategies: Use a pre-built Odoo Docker image as a base.

sprint_goal: Provision core AWS infrastructure using Terraform, focusing on the EKS cluster and managed services.
key_deliverables: A production-ready EKS cluster, VPC, and managed services (RDS, S3, etc.) defined in Terraform.
demo_objectives: Run `terraform plan` and `terraform apply` to provision the staging environment; Connect to the EKS cluster with `kubectl`.
success_criteria: The entire AWS staging environment can be created and destroyed repeatably using Terraform.
risk_factors: High complexity of EKS and IAM configuration (RISK-003).
mitigation_strategies: Use official Terraform modules; extensive testing in a non-production AWS account.

sprint_goal: Finalize system for Go-Live: Implement security hardening, audit trails, data migration, and user training materials.
epic_coverage: Core System & Odoo Foundation, Project Management
key_deliverables: Session timeout feature; Immutable audit trail; Data migration scripts; User training materials.
demo_objectives: Show session timeout warning; View audit trail for a changed record; Demonstrate a data migration dry-run.
success_criteria: System is feature-complete, secure, and ready for UAT and production deployment.
risk_factors: Data migration complexity and risk of data corruption (RISK-002).
mitigation_strategies: Mandate multiple successful dry-runs of migration scripts in staging.
